tweet: Fun Fact: Seven games were played this #WorldSeries and all of them were played at brownfield redevelopments! Both Nats Park and Minute Made Park are great examples of the positive impacts that the redevelopment of brownfields properties can have.

As the last large company paying into the pension fund, their bankruptcy only moves forward the timeline for insolvency. I urge Speaker Pelosi to see the gravity of the situation and bring our legislation, Miners Pension Protection Act (H.R. 935), to the floor for a vote
Murray Energy’s announcement not only highlights the dire state of coal but the fast-approaching insolvency of the UMWA 1974 Pension Fund.
In the face of yet another coal bankruptcy, we must look for ways to help ensure a market for coal exists by promoting fuel security and grid resilience.
We hope that as Murray Energy works to find a solution that will allow them to continue to operate, they remember that thousands of people depend on them for their livelihoods

Murray Energy is one of the largest coal companies in America, their bankruptcy has without a doubt put both current employees, & retired miners on edge As this continues to play out, our office's number 1 priority will be preserving jobs & finding a solution for miners' pensions

@repgregwalden and @HouseCommerce have used this anniversary to not only highlight what we have done, but what we can still do to address the opioid crisis. https://twitter.com/HouseCommerce/status/1187810682319917056 …

What everyone needs to remember is 215 people died yesterday from substance abuse, 215 people died today, and 215 people are going to die tomorrow. Too many families are being torn apart by the horrors of opioid addiction for us to stand by.

We can’t solve this problem overnight, and H.R. 6 alone will not turn the tide in this fight. This Congress, the House has lost focus and refuses to make the opioid crisis a priority. I’m hoping this anniversary can help us regain our momentum. https://twitter.com/HouseCommerce/status/1187371105646006274 …

More than seventy years ago a promise was made by the federal government to our miners. While I am thrilled that our pension bill has passed out of committee, we still need Speaker Pelosi to bring it to the House Floor for a vote @MineWorkers

Today, our bipartisan The Miners Pension Protection Act Passed out of the House Natural Resources Committee! This bill provides a solution to maintain funding for the pension plan and protect benefits for the more than 100,000 retired coal miners and their families!
